name: Zeus vs Monsters – School Edition: Fun Math Game
name_original: Zeus vs Monsters – School Edition: Fun Math Game
description:
Math teacher or not, you'll discover that Zeus vs Monsters is the best classroom tool for math practice. Have your children play fun math games for kids such as this one and compare their test results before and after.
You will be stunned how a math game can change kids' perception about mathematics. Interesting games are the best way of engaging your students during class. They raise motivation and lower inhibition, which has been proven to result in great success.

Players start as Zeus or Athena with a mission to defend Mount Olympus from evil Hades, his monsters and their Spartan army. You defeat them by giving correct answers to math questions on the screen. There is a mythical monster at the end of every fifth level. As you advance, the monsters are harder to defeat and math problems must be solved faster.

SCHOOL EDITION:

▶ Fully unlocked
▶ No in-app purchases
▶ Volume Purchasing
▶ Designed by educators
▶ Adapted to classroom use
▶ Perfect for educational institutions
▶ Social networks connection blocked

FEATURES AND SETTINGS:

▶ Safe, worry-free play with no third-party ads
▶ Addition on/off
▶ Subtraction on/off
▶ Multiplication on/off
▶ Division on/off
▶ Easy level for the youngest players
▶ Medium level for 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th graders
▶ Hard level for grades 5 to 8
▶ 50 levels of basic math operations
▶ Learning about Greek mythology


◆ ◆ ◆ ◆ SPECIAL FEATURE: FOR EDUCATORS ◆ ◆ ◆ ◆

This feature was created to offer children's math progress insight to teachers at schools and to parents and tutors at home. It shows correct and wrong answers to math questions during the game. These results are shown individually for all difficulty levels, addition, subtraction, multiplication and division, indicating which math operation and which range of numbers create problems for kids and need to be worked on. In this manner, student assessment is being done without them being aware of that, which is very convenient for the students themselves because they are relieved of the pressure of being tested.


This is more of an educational tool than it is a game for kids. Besides math practice, it provides fun facts about Greek mythology gods and creatures, such as Zeus, Athena, Hades, Cerberus, Chimera, Titans, Giants, Centaur, Minotaur, Medusa and others.

Parents who have downloaded Zeus already say that the game helps their children in overcoming issues with math operations.
Elementary school teachers have also reviewed Zeus vs Monsters - their impression is that it perfectly fits the classroom needs and is suitable for math practice at home.
